page.title: 14Poetry about Wetton
page.content:
{Rusty Gates} Hanging there all sad and rusty, Left alone to die, No-one dares, no-one bothers, After many years of hard labour, Through wind and rain, hail and snow, Never shouting or complaining, The poor old rusty gate
{The stone gateposts} The stone gateposts just standing there lonely. Thinking maybe one day it's going to be like the dodo, never to come back. I hope that the people in the future don't get rid of the old things. For they have been a help to mankind. They may be ugly and horrible. But give a thought for the poor things And how they must feel.
